description: A game of layout, paint and composite

data.message: Layout, Paint, Composite. Which of these is more severe than which? Which to try to avoid changing as lot?

Alright, You always should try to avoid the repainting of the pixels in the page. this is always caused by bad coded animations in css. 

http://www.stubbornella.org/content/2009/03/27/reflows-repaints-css-performance-making-your-javascript-slow/

layout is the most expensive since it makes the browser to recalculate the position of page elements and then triggers painting and then compositing. that's why animating properties that triggers layout makes severe consequences on page performance and frame rate.
painting has less cost than layout but it's the developer job to find what areas of the page are painted and try to minimize it as possible as he can. the worst thing for page performance is having continuous paints for the whole page within every frame. 
compositing has the least effect on the page performance as it promotes the targeted elements to a separate layer and animation is handled by gpu. the properties that triggers composite only are opacity and transforms. that's why it's advisable to try to fit all page changes and animation within these properties. more resources about this topic
